title: 1Xtra Live event called off after man slashed backstage
text:
Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Wizkid had been due to headline BBC Radio 1Xtra Live in Birmingham on Saturday

BBC Radio 1Xtra's live event in Birmingham has been abandoned after a man suffered a slash wound during an incident backstage.

The 1Xtra Live show at the Arena Birmingham was due to include performances from Aitch, French Montana, Ms Banks and headliner Wizkid.

West Midlands Police said the injured man was helped on site and did not go to hospital.

The BBC said it was sorry to call the event off but safety was a priority.

In a statement, the corporation added: "We are upset and saddened that something like this should happen to a guest at one of our events and we remain in close contact and continue to offer our full support."

A spokesperson would not comment on the identity of the injured man.

West Midlands Police said it was appealing for information following the alleged assault, which it said happened at around 22:00 BST on Saturday.

Skip Twitter post by @WMPolice Anyone with information can contact West Midlands Police via Live Chat at https://t.co/c5j877IEzN 8am - midnight, or call 101 anytime.



To remain anonymous call Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. Please quote crime number 20BW/236014J/19. pic.twitter.com/mfjC7Ex2kW — West Midlands Police (@WMPolice) October 5, 2019 Report

1Xtra Live was billed as an "unmissable night" with a "mix of emerging and established artists". Tickets had sold out - the Arena Birmingham has a capacity of 15,800.

The gig was broadcast live across 1Xtra and Radio 1, but the stream ended when the event was called off.
description: The injured man needed medical help after the incident at the Arena Birmingham, police say.
